explanation: Funds are required for Automated Security Validation (ASV) capability demonstration and reporting to Congress to comply with section 1529 of the FY 2022 National Defense Authorization Act (NDAA). This demonstration requires procurement of ASV Mandiant software licenses, engineering support services, and testing services. ASV Licenses are 12-month term subscription software licenses that require operation and maintenance funding. This reprogramming action provides DISA resources to complete the ASV Mandiant capability demonstration no later than (NLT) October 01, 2024 and brief Congress NLT October 31, 2024. This is a congressional special interest item.

Funds are available because the Automated Security Validation (ASV) capability demonstration requirement was budgeted and enacted in the FY 2023 Procurement, Defense-Wide appropriation vice the Operation and Maintenance appropriation. ASV Mandiant Licenses are 12-month term subscription software licenses that should be purchased with operation and maintenance funding.

Funds are required to procure an F/A-18F (Super Hornet). The Navy sold one E/A-18G Aircraft to Australia. Since the E/A-18G is now out of production, the Navy will replace the E/A-18G with the F/A-18F Super Hornet. The F/A-18F Super Hornet meets the requirements to qualify as a “replacement” because it has the same airframe, engines, and number of seats (two) and is an acceptable substitute item. The Navy requests to use these proceeds to support funding for the 12 program increase aircraft appropriated in the FY22 appropriations bill. This is base budget requirement.
Funds are available due to the sale of one EA-18G to Australia to procure one replacement F/A-18F. Since the EA-18G is now out of production, the Navy will replace the EA-18G sold to Australia
